summary: This document is an internal timeline detailing the events leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. It chronicles his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his cellmate situation, and the final hours before he was found unresponsive in his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the document; details his condition, movements, and ultimate death while in federal custody at MCC.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit from July 29, 2019, until his release to the community on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Reported giving Epstein a telephone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and described him as being in good spirits.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the Special Housing Unit from July 29 to August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Found in Distress, Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was found in a fetal position in his cell, breathing but unresponsive initially. His neck was red. He was placed on suicide watch and received a medical evaluation.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: The Psychology Services Department removed Epstein from suicide watch after daily interactions. He was returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Released, Epstein Alone in Cell
events.description: Cellmate Reyes was released from court to the community and did not return. Epstein was in a legal visit all day and was returned to his cell alone, contrary to his required PSYCH Alert status mandating a cellmate.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive, Pronounced Dead
events.description: Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. CPR was initiated. He was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:36 a.m. Bruising was reported around his neck and an orange makeshift noose was found in the cell.

locations: Hospital (unspecified, where Epstein was pronounced dead)
keyFacts: Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.
An orange makeshift noose and bruising around Epstein's neck were reported by institution staff after his death.
Epstein was left alone in his cell on the night of August 9-10, despite being on a PSYCH Alert that required him to have a cellmate.
Two officers failed to conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. official counts on the night Epstein died; one refused to discuss the matter.
Epstein had been removed from suicide watch on July 29, 2019, after being placed on it on July 23 when he was found in a distressed state.
